conclusion: Analyze the flow of each color separately to determine which containers the liquid will flow into.
Pink liquid flows through the first baffle and splits into two streams, one towards container E and the other towards container F.
Cyan liquid flows through the second baffle and splits into two streams, one towards container E and the other towards container F.
Yellow liquid flows through the third baffle and splits into two streams, one towards container E and the other towards container F.
Green liquid flows through the fourth baffle and splits into two streams, one towards container E and the other towards container F.
Image 1 shows the initial setup with colored liquids entering the system.
Image 2 shows the liquid after passing through the first baffle, where some colors split slightly but not fully yet.

Observing the final placement in Image 3, it is clear that the majority of the flow for each color goes into Container E with only minor amounts going into Container F.
Final Answer: The liquid will predominantly flow into Container E.
